exceptions.exn: In environment s : SF_seq x : R Unable to unify "x" with "last (fst (head (SF_h s, SF_h s) (if Rle_dec (SF_h s) x then (SF_h s, SF_h s) :: seq_cut_down (SF_t s) x else [:: (x, Rmin (SF_h s) x)]))) (unzip1 (behead (if Rle_dec (SF_h s) x then (SF_h s, SF_h s) :: seq_cut_down (SF_t s) x else [:: (x, Rmin (SF_h s) x)])))".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
s: SF_seq
x: R

Goal:
last (SF_h (SF_cut_down s x)) (SF_lx (SF_cut_down s x)) = x

Premises:
SF_cut_down = fun (sf : SF_seq) (x : R) => let s := seq_cut_down ((SF_h sf, SF_h sf) :: SF_t sf) x in {| SF_h := fst (head (SF_h sf, SF_h sf) s); SF_t := behead s |} : SF_seq -> R -> SF_seq Argument scopes are [_ R_scope]
last = fun T : Type => fix last (x : T) (s : seq T) {struct s} : T := match s with | [::] => x | x' :: s' => last x' s' end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
SF_lx = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => SF_h s :: unzip1 (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> seq R Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_h = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => let (SF_h, _) := s in SF_h : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> R Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_cut_down_step : forall (s : SF_seq) (x eps : R), SF_h s <= x <= last (SF_h s) (SF_lx s) -> seq_step (SF_lx s) < eps -> seq_step (SF_lx (SF_cut_down s x)) < eps
SF_cut_up_step : forall (s : SF_seq) (x eps : R), SF_h s <= x <= last (SF_h s) (SF_lx s) -> seq_step (SF_lx s) < eps -> seq_step (SF_lx (SF_cut_up s x)) < eps
SF_last_cat : forall x0 y : SF_seq, last (SF_h x0) (SF_lx x0) = head (SF_h y) (SF_lx y) -> last (SF_h (SF_cat x0 y)) (SF_lx (SF_cat x0 y)) = last (SF_h y) (SF_lx y) where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
SF_cut_down_h : forall (s : SF_seq) (x : R), SF_h s <= x -> SF_h (SF_cut_down s x) = SF_h s
SF_cut_down_pointed : forall (s : SF_seq) (x : R), SF_h s <= x -> pointed_subdiv s -> pointed_subdiv (SF_cut_down s x)
SF_cat_pointed : forall x y : SF_seq, last (SF_h x) (SF_lx x) = head (SF_h y) (SF_lx y) -> pointed_subdiv x -> pointed_subdiv y -> pointed_subdiv (SF_cat x y)
seq_step = fun s : seq R => foldr Rmax 0 (pairmap (fun x y : R => Rabs (y - x)) (head 0 s) (behead s)) : seq R -> R Argument scope is [seq_scope]
SF_cut_up = fun (sf : SF_seq) (x : R) => let s := seq_cut_up ((SF_h sf, SF_h sf) :: SF_t sf) x in {| SF_h := fst (head (SF_h sf, SF_h sf) s); SF_t := behead s |} : SF_seq -> R -> SF_seq Argument scopes are [_ R_scope]
nth_last : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s (Init.Nat.pred (size s)) = last x0 s
last_cons : forall (T : Type) (x y : T) (s : seq T), last x (y :: s) = last y s
SF_last_lx : forall (x0 : ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), fst (SF_last x0 s0) = last 0 (SF_lx s0) where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
SF_map = fun (T T0 : Type) (f : T -> T0) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := SF_h s; SF_t := [seq (fst x, f (snd x)) | x <- SF_t s] |} : forall T T0 : Type, (T -> T0) -> SF_seq -> SF_seq Arguments T, T0 are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope _]
index = fun (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x : eqtype.Equality.sort T) => find (pred_of_simpl (T:=eqtype.Equality.sort T) (eqtype.pred1 x)) : forall T : eqtype.Equality.type, eqtype.Equality.sort T -> seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T) -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ seq_scope]
SF_cons = fun (T : Type) (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := fst h; SF_t := (SF_h s, snd h) :: SF_t s |} : forall T : Type, R * T -> SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
mem_last : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x : eqtype.Equality.sort T) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), last x s \in x :: s
last_rcons : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq T) (z : T), last x (rcons s z) = z
SF_last = fun (T : Type) (y0 : T) (s : SF_seq) => last (SF_h s, y0) (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, T -> SF_seq -> R * T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
sorted_last : forall (s : seq R) (i : nat), sorted Rle s -> (i < size s)%nat -> forall x0 : R, nth x0 s i <= last x0 s
last_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 x : T) (s : seq T), last x s = nth x0 (x :: s) (size s)
sorted_dec : forall (s : seq R) (x0 x : R), sorted Rle s -> head x0 s <= x <= last x0 s -> {i : nat | nth x0 s i <= x < nth x0 s (S i) /\ (S (S i) < size s)%nat} + {nth x0 s (size s - 2) <= x <= nth x0 s (size s - 1)}
pointed_subdiv = fun ptd : SF_seq => forall i : nat, (i < SF_size ptd)%nat -> nth 0 (SF_lx ptd) i <= nth 0 (SF_ly ptd) i <= nth 0 (SF_lx ptd) (S i) : SF_seq -> Prop
SF_size_lx : forall s0 : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s0) = S (SF_size s0) where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
SF_lx_rev : forall s0 : SF_seq, SF_lx (SF_rev s0) = rev (SF_lx s0) where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
SF_size_lx_ly : forall s0 : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s0) = S (size (SF_ly s0)) where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
SF_seq_bij : forall s0 : SF_seq, SF_make (SF_lx s0) (SF_ly s0) (SF_size_lx_ly s0) = s0 where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
SF_rev_0 : forall s0 : SF_seq, size (rev (SF_lx s0)) = S (size (rev (SF_ly s0))) where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
nth0 : forall (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T), nth x0 s 0 = head x0 s
cats1 : forall (T : Type) (s : seq T) (z : T), s ++ [:: z] = rcons s z
SF_behead = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := head (SF_h s) (unzip1 (SF_t s)); SF_t := behead (SF_t s) |} : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_lx_cat : forall x0 y : SF_seq, SF_lx (SF_cat x0 y) = SF_lx x0 ++ behead (SF_lx y) where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
SF_rev = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => SF_make (rev (SF_lx s)) (rev (SF_ly s)) (SF_rev_0 s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_cons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), P (SF_cons h s0)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
rcons_uniq : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (s : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) (x : eqtype.Equality.sort T), uniq (rcons s x) = (x \notin s) && uniq s
SF_lx_rcons : forall (s0 : SF_seq) (h : R * ?T), SF_lx (SF_rcons s0 h) = rcons (SF_lx s0) (fst h) where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
unzip1_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) (size t) -> unzip1 (zip s t) = s
head_rev : forall (x0 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), head x0 (rev l) = last x0 l where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
last_rev : forall (x0 : ?T) (l : seq ?T), last x0 (rev l) = head x0 l where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
SF_cons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), P s0 -> P (SF_cons h s0)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s where ?T : [s : SF_seq x : R |- Type]
Rabs_R0 = match Rcase_abs 0 as s return ((if s then - 0 else 0) = 0) with | left r => (fun H : ~ 0 < 0 => False_ind (- 0 = 0) (H r)) (Rlt_irrefl 0) | right _ => eq_refl end : Rabs 0 = 0
SF_cut_up_h : forall (s : SF_seq) (x : R), SF_h (SF_cut_up s x) = x
